ba0e2187d38212ed.title: Application Developer
ba0e2187d38212ed.description: application developer use your skills in asp net and salesforce join hydro tasmania’s retail technology team at momentum energy 2 permanent positions in melbourne cbd  hydro tasmania is australia's largest producer of renewable energy and is a leader in creating a clean energy future for australia  we believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in our people and helps provide a better service to our customers  continuing growth  excellent working conditions and career opportunities make hydro tasmania and its subsidiaries momentum energy and entura a great place to work   about the role  as a member of the hydro tasmania’s information services and systems within our momentum energy retail business in melbourne  and you’ll develop and support application software for specific business solutions   what it looks like   developing solutions to the intended solution architecture with the digital team building systems using tools such as tdd  bdd  ci/cd and automation ensuring that documentation produced for solutions working closely with digital product owner  ux and ba resources to ensure development solution outcomes are met working with the scrum master and digital product owners  with technical guidance being provided by the digital team lead collaborating with all members of agile development teams across the organisation and help drive the agile transformation  the "must-have" skills that you will bring are in   asp net salesforce lightning web component  lwc   and some of your other "nice-to-have" skills may include   development skills in react or angular 2  aws and/or another commercial cloud provider development experience in one or more of the following languages  javascript/typescript  java  python   net  react  html  css  sass or less  single page application cms such as sitefinity or sitecore delivering solutions designed as microservices or microfrontends integrating with adobe  google or other analytics platforms  other things about you  you’ll bring outstanding stakeholder engagement skills  along with exceptional communication skills  and you’re skilled in driving results and efficiently contributing to innovative customer solutions  you understand targets and timelines have an ability to transform ambiguity into solutions through collaboration and creativity  you’ll also bring demonstrated similar development experience from an agile process and scrum environment   what we offer  located in fantastic melbourne cbd offices  you’ll work in a collaborative team environment  and in an incredibly fun and rewarding business that values its people and customers  you’ll receive an attractive salary  benefits that include wellness programs  discounted electricity and gas  and flexible working arrangements   if you like the sound of this role  we’d love to hear from you! to apply for this position  please attach your resume and a cover letter detailing what you’ll bring to the position    applications close at 9 00am on friday 8th may 2020

429571a7c9b1b4f1.title: Marklogic Developer
429571a7c9b1b4f1.description: job description   meet orbis  as a subsidiary of orbis technologies  inc   turn-key systems pty limited  provides industry-leading enterprise content management system products and services to a global client portfolio  turn-key has been developing software for the publishing industry for more than 20 years  orbis technologies  inc  is a us-based  award-winning  veteran-owned  global leader experiencing explosive growth  we deliver innovative technology to companies ranging from fortune 50 to the federal government  we are recognized for our advanced semantic driven enterprise content management platforms and highly specialized cloud analytics software  our elite team of subject-matter experts helps clients assess  optimize  and build next-generation digital content platforms  our culture is centered around bringing top talent to solve challenging technical problems for brand-name clients  you will see unparalleled freedom to explore technologies and support mission-critical issues  be at the forefront of building the next generation of semantic technologies on a global scale with orbis technologies  start your journey today to become an integral part of our technical team as a marklogic developer! work with world-class clients  at orbis  you will have the opportunity to work with our incredible clients ranging from the federal government to commercial  including healthcare  biotech  manufacturing  and publishing  much of the work we do is confidential  so we can’t name drop here  that’s because we are classy  international opportunities & relocation assistance  with orbis  you can go places! we have offices in sydney  australia  chennai  india  audubon  pa  annapolis  md; and orlando  fl  staff has the opportunity for international travel  international experience  and relocation packages to help make the transition to your new home seamless and exciting  develop leadership & engage in mentorship  we are dedicated to developing our staff internally towards leadership positions  we support educational goals and personal growth  including internal learning tracks  to expand your skills  our management team leads and mentors our staff to achieve success  we cultivate an environment for our team to thrive  our awards  we stand behind an incredible collection of awards and recognition  our team is proud of our record  our accolades include  deloitte technology  fast 50  recognized best places to work  america’s fastest growing private companies  500 inc  position summary  we are looking for a mark logic developer  to support and manage marklogic and our xml content management system  this includes the maintenance  extension  and tuning of the marklogic database as well as supporting and extending our product requirements for publishing and content creation workflows  essential duties & responsibilities  support marklogic and product system environment  coordinate upgrades  patches  troubleshooting  etc  update  create and implement features  functionality  back end processing and workflows in the product system  per predefined business requirements  support metadata and content integration with disparate internal  global systems  monitoring and tuning of the marklogic environment to achieve optimal performance  future application development on top of the marklogic infrastructure  required experience   mandatory requirements & qualifications  legal authorization to work in australia  a bachelor’s degree in a technical field  5+ years of experience as a software developer or system administrator  minimum 3+ years of experience with marklogic or any nosql database  strong organizational  problem-solving  and analytical skills  preferred skills & qualifications  strong java skills  including j2ee and xpath/xquery  strong xml development skills  xsd and xslt is a must  hands-on experience in xslts  dtd  xsds   strong experience in xml  xquery and xpath  experience with marklogic xml server is a major plus  web services  soap and restful  interactions with marklogic server  xcc  marklogic proprietary middleware  marklogic content processing framework  jboss developer studio  or eclipse-based ide   jboss enterprise application server  jboss soa-p  v4 or v5   experience in agile development methodology  ability to work independently  with a strong focus on problem solving and identification of systemic issues that can lead to an optimized process or workflow  demonstrate a positive attitude and willingness to help resolve a wide range of issues  ability to work with various size teams across the organization in different locations  publishing experience is a plus  from  orbis technologies

a11917643b401420.title: GIS Administrator/Developer
a11917643b401420.description: reference  vg/e20038756 are you read to shape the future of victoria police?  do you want to be part of a transformation journey?  victoria police have an exciting opportunity for a professional administrator / developer to work as part of a specialised team responsible for managing  maintaining and developing our enterprise geographic information systems  egis  platform  the incumbent will administer and enhance victoria police's egis platform to ensure it is kept at the highest possible standard in accordance with defined ict frameworks and processes   this role will be working in a professional  highly dynamic and established team of ict services professionals and will be regularly exposed to the various disciplines that victoria police operates in   victoria police is a contemporary and agile workplace and supports flexible working arrangements    your duties will include   providing administration support to the egis platform  implementing changes  additions and enhancements to the egis platform  provision of specialist technical advice supporting the lifecycle and resolution of escalated issues and mitigation of risks  for the egis platform and services  ensuring data accuracy  completeness and auditing is maintained with efficient and effective methods to ensure that information is of the highest standard possible  maintaining skill proficiency  including improvement where deemed necessary  and upgrading any additional or new skills on the appropriate position skills list  utilising tools  techniques and processes to drive and improve the egis platform  contributing to the effective management of the egis platform to ensure it runs reliably  effectively and efficiently    as the successful applicant  you will have   minimum three  3  years of relevant experience in a multidisciplinary ict role  excellent experience and understanding of front-end technologies such as javascript & python  excellent interpersonal skills together with demonstrated strong written communication skills  demonstrated specialist technical and functional knowledge of egis software and platforms  their components and their integrations  including geographic concepts and spatial data management  proven ability to monitor client and stakeholder satisfaction  and constructively manage stakeholder issues to ensure positive outcomes for the stakeholder and the department tertiary qualifications in gis  spatial systems or directly related discipline  or demonstrated equivalent experience  knowledge and skills will be highly regarded  training or experience in safe  itil or cobit frameworks  experience working in an agile and dynamic technology environment    requirements and relevant information   position will be located at the victoria police centre  vpc   637 flinders street  docklands  in 2020 the vpc will be relocating to 311 spencer street  docklands  applicants must be an australian citizen  permanent resident or hold a valid work permit or visa  the successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include fingerprint checks and misconduct screening    your application must include   resume completed application form - attached to the job advertisement    applications close midnight  monday 11 may 2020 - no applications will be accepted via email   for further information on this role please contact  anthony monteiro on  03  8600 8142 or via email anthony monteiro@police vic gov au   if you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process  please contact vps recruitment via email vpsrecruitment@police vic gov au or on  03  8335 8081   about us   victoria police is a large organisation employing police  public servants and protective services officers  victoria police provides support to the community 24 hours a day  365 days of the year   at victoria police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve  we continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders  ages  religions  disability  sexual orientation  family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of aboriginal and torres strait islander heritage   find out what it is like working as a victorian public servant for victoria police  https //www police vic gov au/vps  favourite job  print  share 14 jobs are currently listed for victoria police job type  full time job classification  vpsg4 contact  anthony monteiro | 03 8600 8142 or anthony monteiro@police vic gov au job attachments  1  position description c3331 docx 2  vps application form 20038756 docx

a13fbb36fe87def5.title: IBM Software Developer IoT/Edge/Distributed Computing in Melbourne
a13fbb36fe87def5.description: introduction software developers at ibm are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design  code  test  and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time  bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do  whether you are working on projects internally or for a client  software development is critical to the success of ibm and our clients worldwide  at ibm  you will use the latest software development tools  techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of   your role and responsibilities  ibm software developer iot/edge/distributed computing in melbourne offered on a permanent regular employment basis or on a fixed term 24 months basis work in one of ibm’s 12 elite global research labs position located in beautiful melbourne  australia compensation package from $91 000  full-time equivalent inclusive of superannuation  and will be determined based on successful candidate’s relevant skills and experience   from landing the first astronauts on the moon to building the first cognitive system to win jeopardy! ibm with its diverse culture  continues to be the innovative spark of the computing revolutions that shape our world  at the core of ibm’s innovation are its 12 global research labs  ibm research australia is a young  proud and diverse community working on industry solutions  conceiving  designing and building next generation enterprise systems   ibm research – australia in melbourne has a strong track record of research in the area of iot/edge and seeks to develop a peer-to-peer environment in which edge devices can share resources in an autonomous and secure manner  the topic is highly multi-disciplinary and combines distributed computing with machine learning and load balancing  the group strives to do novel research while at the same time developing deployable assets and patenting ideas along the way  the role requires adaptability to other projects in the lab  which include natural language processing and image/pattern recognition   what will i be doing? work with a team of established researchers and software engineers to develop state of the art technologies in the field of iot and edge devices – with a focus on peer-to-peer device interaction and distributed computing multidisciplinary topic combining pure research with asset development and real world application with clients expected to work with researchers and co-develop software assets deployed on a range of devices to allow autonomous and cooperative behaviours work with heterogenous compute environments consisting of everything from small devices  raspberry pi’s  laptops  and cloud servers  what skills will i need? distributed computing  networking  transport layers strong python skills experience with realtime systems and machine learning hands-on experience with edge devices and raspberry pi team code development with github experience with go is preferred experience with natural language processing is desirable experience with deep learning is desirable   what experience do i need? bachelor’s degree in computer science  it or related technical field demonstrated experience with iot/edge devices demonstrated experience with containers and orchestration experience in ui design and interactive visualization is desirable eo statement ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer  all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race  colour  religion  gender  gender identity or expression  sexual orientation  national origin  genetics  disability  age  or veteran status  ibm is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status  sign me up! if you tick these boxes  and are ready to start your next challenge with a career at ibm – click “apply” today  to find out more  head to www ibm com au/careers    required technical and professional expertise as above   preferred technical and professional expertise  as above  about business unit with more than 3 000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents  ibm research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems  join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing  augmented intelligence  quantum computing  and blockchain  to name a few   your life @ ibm what matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? what about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? are you looking for a culture of openness  collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? what about all of these? if so  then ibm could be your next career challenge  join us  not to do something better  but to attempt things you never thought possible   impact  inclusion  infinite experiences  do your best work ever   about ibm ibm’s greatest invention is the ibmer  we believe that progress is made through progressive thinking  progressive leadership  progressive policy and progressive action  ibmers believe that the application of intelligence  reason and science can improve business  society and the human condition  restlessly reinventing since 1911  we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world  with more than 380 000 ibmers serving clients in 170 countries   location statement for additional information about location requirements  please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application   being you @ ibm ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer  all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race  color  religion  gender  gender identity or expression  sexual orientation  national origin  genetics  disability  age  or veteran status  ibm is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status

c6cf3123394d8c7e.title: Software Developer
c6cf3123394d8c7e.description: the company  want to be part of an office of dedicated professionals across a mix of departments? would you like to work in a place where earned opportunities exist for those who are hardworking  diligent  clever and friendly?  ibisworld has been an established player in the business information industry for over 40 years  with offices in australia  us  uk and china  ibisworld is one of the largest information companies in the world  the melbourne office is the global head office  and is located at the top of collins street   ibisworld is australia's richest source of business information  publishing independent  comprehensive and up-to-date research on over 700 industries - including statistics  analysis and forecasts   the role  ibisworld is looking for a full-stack web developer who can hit the ground running  as a part of our team  you will develop and maintain the company's websites and related back-end applications  this permanent  full-time opportunity is suitable for an experienced developer who is ready to mentor colleagues and deliver results in a customer-focused environment   responsibilities include  but are not limited to    strong asp net core/vb net/c# using visual studio 2015-2017 strong sql server 2008/2014; understand triggers  stored procedures  etc  strong performance tuning experience experience with web api and sso experience with iis experience with unit testing proficient with cross-browser html and css programming  javascript  jquery and mvc/webforms understanding of design patterns proven history working the full project lifecycle of the web development process from client requirement gathering through to testing and documentation experience in an agile environment would be beneficial ability to effectively translate business requirements into a technical design and transform that design into a working application ability to be flexible and work with non-technical stakeholders who often have limited technical knowledge commercial approach to development work; adhering to tight deadlines  being self-motivated in a multidisciplinary environment is essential excellent communication skills - both written and verbal ability to work independently with minimal supervision  all applicants must be authorised for employment in australia and be available to work full-time in our melbourne office   if you think you are the ideal candidate for this position  please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter  in your cover letter  please briefly explain how your skills and experience align with this position  please note that only successful candidates will be contacted and only applications with a cover letter will be considered

979c1a8cfd38d0eb.title: Full-Stack .NET Developer
979c1a8cfd38d0eb.description: utilise your skills with angular 2 +   net core and domain driven design microsoft gold partner government client melbourne cbd  dialog is seeking a full-stack  net developer to join our melbourne professional consulting team  we are seeking a person who will bring previous experience in developing software across the microsoft  net enterprise application stack  and who has a focus on great delivery outcomes  this role will be working within an established team directly with a key client  criteria for selection will include  significant experience developing in software across the microsoft  net enterprise application stack demonstrated experience front-end development using javascript  jquery  html  css  angular 2+ deep understanding of domain driven design and other software design patterns proven experience with orm  windows services  iis and msmq proficient with ms sql server databases  git and microsoft visual studio team server about dialog - as australia's largest privately owned it services company our key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools  technologies and methodologies  dialog is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects  training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere  as a dialog consultant engaging with these clients you will  work with key stakeholders to achieve world's best practice processes in major projects work on a wide variety of interesting and challenging assignments work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort  creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued have extensive training opportunities through the dialog academy  which offers over 1 500 it and 800 business skills courses work with like-minded colleagues who share information and focus on the goal  driving the project and their careers further and faster at dialog  our whole approach is based on four key values  involved  committed  can do  always  it's these values  applied to every project  which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused  these same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people   join our team of professional  enthusiastic and experienced consultants  where communication  learning and knowledge sharing are prized  we offer an excellent benefits package   dialog is an equal opportunity employer   applicants should be australian or nz citizens or australian permanent residents  if you are not an australian or new zealand citizen you will need to provide your passport and visa for our review

761c33683f689a63.title: Web Developer
761c33683f689a63.description: the role we are seeking a web developer to work on a new web-based hris system built on asp net / webapi and angular js  working with a live style guide and having the ability to make independent interface design choices where necessary  having the freedom to implement the best possible solution while working with the current technology stack  the web developer will work closely with the project leaders to ensure engineering integrity  responsibilities this is a broad role that will benefit someone that likes to get their hands dirty on all aspects of software development  the web developer will also help run sprint planning and will be responsible for sub-tasking user stories  taking pride in building and engineering solutions instead of just writting code  the successful applicant will relish solving problems and be comfortable making decisionsautonomously  having extensive experience and a belief in agile environment as a development methodology the web developer will be focused on delivering the best possible version of a produce  experience required mandatory satisfactory police clearance minimum 3 years commercial experience in web development in the technologies listed below front end technologies - html  css  javascript and strong skills in one of the following frameworks  angular js reactjs knockout js asp net / c# webapi desirable entity framework with relational database es6 / babel css pre-processors such as sass / less javascript build toolssuch as gulp / grunt javascript testing frameworks such as jasmine or mocha cross browser development knowledge understanding of autofac and dependency injection understanding of single page application design ability in building responsive web applications agile methodologies like scrum what’s next frontier software offers a great team environment and friendly culture to work in  along with a competitive remuneration package  if you are looking to join an active  enthusiastic team of professionals working in a challenging and stimulating environment  then this role is for you  apply now and you will be invited to register via our candidate portal where the application process will be detailed  applications must include a cover letter  with salary expectations  and current resume  no recruitment agencies please
